intro: Turpinia borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean turpinia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Oleaceae, which includes olive and jasmine plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in secondary vegetation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
